intro: Aquilegia flabellata var. humiliata, commonly known as the dwarf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features striking, spurred flowers that range in color from purple to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a soft, velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained, loamy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
